Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the impact of the bill by stating that it makes it "so that drunk drivers who kill have an easier time of it."
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the bill makes it easier for drunk drivers who kill.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the bill supported by Gov. Scott Walker is solely responsible for any perceived ease for drunk drivers who kill, without considering other factors or alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that may contribute to any perceived ease for drunk drivers who kill, such as changes in law enforcement practices or other legal reforms.
